title: Representative Learning Design Simulation Course for VR-Based Cricket Skill Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of cricket rules and experience with simple batting/bowling techniques
context.additional_context: Scientifically approaches the efficiency of sports skill learning by integrating kinematic analysis with mathematics education

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in predicting the trajectory of a cricket ball during batting in a VR simulation environment
Identify and apply at least three optimal swing trajectories under various bowling conditions (speed, angle, spin)
Improve swing motion efficiency by 20% using a real-time biomechanical feedback system
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
